lead_paragraph: Lonny Baxter, who played for the Charlotte Bobcats last season but had been scheduled to play in Italy this season, was sentenced yesterday to two months in jail after pleading guilty to charges of illegally carrying a gun a few blocks from the White House. When uniformed Secret Service officers responded to reports of shots being fired from a white sport utility vehicle in the early morning hours of Aug. 16, they found a gun and spent shell casings in the vehicle that Baxter was driving. Baxter apologized to Judge Craig Iscoe of District of Columbia Superior Court for the “careless, stupid, selfish act that I committed.”.
